Functions

int32_t NetConnStartup (const char *pParams)
 Bring the network connection module to life. Does not actually start any network activity. More...
 
int32_t NetConnQuery (const char *pGamertag, NetConfigRecT *pList, int32_t iListSize)
 Returns the index of the given gamertag. If the gamertag is not present, treat pList as a pointer to an XUID, and find the user by XUID. Otherwise return the index of the first logged in user. More...
 
int32_t NetConnConnect (const NetConfigRecT *pConfig, const char *pOption, int32_t iData)
 Used to bring the networking online with a specific configuration. Uses the configuration returned by NetConnQuery. More...
 
int32_t NetConnDisconnect (void)
 Used to bring down the network connection. After calling this, it would be necessary to call NetConnConnect to bring the connection back up or NetConnShutdown to completely shutdown all network support. More...
 
int32_t NetConnControl (int32_t iControl, int32_t iValue, int32_t iValue2, void *pValue, void *pValue2)
 Set module behavior based on input selector. More...
 
int32_t NetConnStatus (int32_t iKind, int32_t iData, void *pBuf, int32_t iBufSize)
 Check general network connection status. Different selectors return different status attributes. More...
 
int32_t NetConnShutdown (uint32_t bStopEE)
 Shutdown the network code and return to idle state. More...
 
void NetConnSleep (int32_t iMilliSecs)
 Sleep the application (yield thread) for some number of milliseconds. More...
 
int32_t NetConnAddLocalUser (int32_t iLocalUserIndex, const EA::User::IEAUser *pLocalUser)
 Use this function to tell netconn about a newly detected local user on the local console. More...
 
int32_t NetConnRemoveLocalUser (int32_t iLocalUserIndex, const EA::User::IEAUser *pLocalUser)

enum NetConnAccountPickerStateE

Enumerator
ST_ACTPICK_IDLE 

initial account picker state

ST_ACTPICK_OPEN 

account picker is open

ST_ACTPICK_CLOSE 

account picker is closed

enum NetConnEvnStateE

environment determination async op state

Enumerator
ST_ENV_INVALID 

environment determination has not started yet

ST_ENV_INPROGRESS 

environment determination in progress

ST_ENV_COMPLETED 

environment determination done and valid

enum NetConnNetworkStatusStateE

network status thread state

Enumerator
ST_STATUS_INVALID 

network status thread is not started

ST_STATUS_VALID 

network status thread gone through the first time

ST_STATUS_INPROGRESS 

network status thread in progress

ST_STATUS_RETRY 

network status thread need to retry

ST_STATUS_EXIT 

network status thread has exited

Function Documentation

int32_t NetConnAddLocalUser ( int32_t  iLocalUserIndex,
const EA::User::IEAUser *  pLocalUser 
)

Use this function to tell netconn about a newly detected local user on the local console.

Parameters
iLocalUserIndex- index at which DirtySDK needs to insert this user it its internal user array
pLocalUser- pointer to associated IEAUser
Returns
int32_t - 0 for success; negative for error
Version
01/16/2014 (mclouatre)

References NetConnCommonAddLocalUser().

int32_t NetConnRemoveLocalUser ( int32_t  iLocalUserIndex,
const EA::User::IEAUser *  pLocalUser 
)

Use this function to tell netconn about a local user that no longer exists.

Parameters
iLocalUserIndex- index in the internal DirtySDK user array at which the user needs to be cleared
pLocalUser- pointer to associated IEAUser
Returns
int32_t - 0 for success; negative for error
Version
01/16/2014 (mclouatre)

References NetConnCommonRemoveLocalUser().
